issue.title: §[res.on.exception.handling]#3 cannot apply to types with implicitly declared destructors

blockquote.p: Destructor operations defined in the C++ standard library shall not throw exceptions. Every destructor in the C++ standard library shall behave as if it had a non-throwing exception specification.

discussion.p: However, types like pair and array have implicitly declared destructors, where #8 applies:

blockquote.p: The exception specification for an implicitly-declared destructor, or a destructor without a noexcept-specifier, is potentially-throwing if and only if any of the destructors for any of its potentially constructed subobjects is potentially-throwing or the destructor is virtual and the destructor of any virtual base class is potentially throwing.
In particular, the effects are undefined in the following cases: […]

li.p: (2.4) — if any replacement function or handler function or destructor operation exits via an exception, unless specifically allowed in the applicable Required behavior: paragraph.

discussion.p: and the referred to UB happens before [res.on.exception.handling] could apply.
Priority to 3 after discussion on the reflector.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4820.

blockquote.p: -3- Destructor operations defined in the C++ standard library shall not throw exceptions. Every explicitly declared destructor in the C++ standard library shall behave as if it had a non-throwing exception specification.
